author: Log Halley
review: 8/10game is good, wish it focused more on being a student at hogwarts and less about being a hero/chosen one saving the lands of Scotland its too little of a student wizard RPG, and too much of a generic fantasy open world action gamegonna drop tons of complaints in no particular order- the game is too little simulative. cant sleep, cant sit, cant even emote for screenshots— we can eat, but its just grabbing bites of decorative items. whats the point of the great hall? — the castle at night is completely empty including dorms. wheres everyone gone? — also there's no curfew at all. which i found weird because i played other harry potter games. — classes are underdeveloped. theres only 1 each, and then the assignments. you go, kill 2 wolves, come back and you learn a spell. could have been fun, its just a chore this way— no house cup— no quidditch— no potions minigame - the loot/gear system sucks, and cosmetic being tied to it sucks more— equipment with quality tiers doesnt fit the setting at all, no reason why putting on glasses should increse my defence— anytime i change gear, i have to go back and change the appearance of the item. most people dont want to wear funny glasses, but need them for stats, so we have to put them on and then change the appearance to have back our look— also there's too much gear, and most of it is pointless. so many times i get into a dungeon, i solve a puzzle, i win a fight, and my reward is a jacket with worse stats than the one i have. this happens hundreds of times, filling up my inventory, making me go back and forth from hogsmeade to sell the stuff, with no button to sell it all, which means all the items have to be sold one by one, and there's hundreds— too many cosmetics clip with each other. some scarves are nice, but they dont fit my other clothes- the open world is handled the ubisoft way— its big for the sake of being big, and its filled with hundreds of pointless copy-pasted activities. there are way way too many copy-pasted merlin trials, and their unskippable cutscene kills me a little every time it plays— also dungeons, and in a way hamlets. copy-pasted content made to fill a map that's too big for no reason- MC is a psychopath— this character kills hundreds and blames them after— i cant understand how avada kedavra is unforgivable, but reducing someone to the size of a mouse and stepping on them to death isnt— we kill bad evil poachers, while we kidnap animals building our noahs ark to farm their ingredients. the excess animals we "rescue", we sell for gold. totally unlike poachers right— i know this is a game, but how our story is that we're a wizard for a few days and we already manage to kill both goblins and adult wizard could have been handled better— also the character repeats his reaction lines too much. same for the floo powder lady.- no companion system— we get people with us on some missions, but most of the time we're alone. i played the harry potter games on ps2 and our character was almost never alone. skyrims been out a few months, shouldnt be complicated to copy the way companions work— also houses are made pointless. i get that you didnt want to make every slytherin evil and every gryffindor good, but you went way too far in the other direction, making houses just colors to wear. there’s also very little friend/enemy dynamic with other students— also where's the companion from ravenclaw? we get 1 character with a questline from every other house, other than ravenclaw. maybe i missed it but i dont think so. amit is fun, he should have more quests— why no pets? we're at hogwarts, yet we cant have a owl, a mouse, a cat. we can name animals in the room of requirements, but our interactions are limited to magically feeding and brushing. cant even pet them. - character creation sucks a lot— too little options, and my characters look different than it did in the character creator. seems like hes been taking daily sunbaths for 2 weeks between when i created him and when i got to play him- broom controls are bad, and the up/down being tied to the right stick means we wont ever be able to control the camera to look up or down- alohomora is a spell used to open locks, it shouldnt lead to a lockpicking minigame— also alohomora having 3 tiers sucks. unlocking it and then still being unable to open all doors made it feel wrong, and it adds the chore of looking for demiguises before exploring more- olivander becomes useless after the game. wish he would at least sell wand handles- wish we had a POV mode to take screenshots. anytime i take one, i get the back of my character taking half the pic

author: wileyknight
review: Love this game so far but it has some things to fix. As of now there are issues with textures showing up with solarized colors where the base texture will bleach white and be speckled with pink, green and blue pixels. This usually happens when close to being outside or outside where there are trees, bushes, etc. Which brings up the next issue. Dancing trees! Trees and bushes after a bit of time playing around 20 minutes or so will dance wildly shooting their textures across the sky, obstructing everything in view. This seems to happen in waves. Those will calm down and its the grasses cue and they do the same followed by the bushes then back to the trees. It's annoying at first but eventually requires a restart of the game because it also causes the frames to drop over time. Did I mention that birds also like to explode their textures when this is happening. I can usually play for about 20-30 minutes before these things start happening.Something that annoys me. You are allowed to customize the appearance of clothing items that you wear. If you change you clothing because lets say you find something else to wear that gives you more defense, offense, whatever (This happens all the time!) then you lose the appearance that you've chosen. You have to go back and waste time changing the appearance of every item of clothing every time you get something better or look stupid running around with a silly hat when you are supposed to be a master of the dark arts.Sometimes when running thru Hogwarts light will bleed thru walls and cracks from the outside.Stuttering issues. Seems to stutter more when in a cut scene than actual game play.As of now those are my only gripes. The controls are good. Except maybe flying but that might just take time to get used to or maybe the broom. There is plenty to do and lots of surprises. I'm playing on hard and even that feels a little easy. The attention to detail is beautiful. Facial animation could be better though.Most of these problems can be easily addressed and none are a reason to not get the game. The value of entertainment you'll get from playing and exploring will more than cover the cost. I am just over 40 and am enjoying the game along with a 20 year old son and my 7 year old loves it too.

author: Medium-Rare Lethargy
review: The first few hours of this game felt so full of life, so inexplicably exciting; I really felt hooked. Unfortunately, the 'magic' only lasts for so long. The remainder of the game is persistently dull.   Every puzzle mechanic or setting that is briefly interesting seem to only have been used as a little feather to tickle our noses with, it's just disappointing to see the amount of obvious love that has gone into many parts of the world go to waste because this overblown officially licensed fan fiction tries to reach it's fingers into too many pies. I don't even want to really get into how uncanny it is that in spite of anything our character does in the story or side, the worst consequence you can really get is a bit of sass or a mild scolding.   Most folks probably don't expect anything mindblowing from this game, perhaps they just wanna explore the recesses of their nostalgia within the recesses of Hogwarts. This game DOES encourage exploration, and the castle truly IS beautifully made and presented. However, the way they encourage exploration is a far cry from being engaging in any sense of the word. Spamming REVELIO as I jaunt through the halls, it really takes away from much of the sense of amazement I reckon I would have if these areas were presented to us in a different context. Our introductions to the various classes of Hogwarts are an adequate example of that being done, of exploring the god forsaken castle through the inquisitive eyes of our youthful protagonist and their peers. It's a crying shame these classes are only one-offs and the rest of the game is so much more focused on other parts of the world it's a wonder that they felt the need to include the school at all.   Also ♥♥♥♥ the vapid ♥♥♥♥ JKR, donate to charity  if you're up to it.

author: LadyLys ♡
review: 🪄 As a Harry Potter fan, I feel like I can speak for the majority of the community & say that is the game that we've been waiting for. I've just barely dove in but I am so pleased with the story-line & graphics already. Do yourself a favor and BUY IT, even if you're not a Harry Potter fan...I'm confident that you'll enjoy! Signed, Your Local Ravenclaw 🪄

author: Cyz
review: This game is great. It nails the feel of Harry Potter and sits in the rarefied space as a great book, into entertaining movies, into a vibrant and engaging video game adaptation. Lots of hours went into making this a well polish, and fun game, and it shows. I knew this was going to be an enjoyable ride two seconds into the game, when you’re on your way to Hogwarts in a flying carriage you’re attacked by a dragon. I want to say first and foremost that this third person RPG is made for fans of Harry Potter, not necessarily hardcore gamers. This isn’t a bad thing, just don’t go into this game thinking it will be on a dark soul’s level when it comes to difficulty. I beat it on the hardest difficult with minimal reloading. This game is worth the money and it and will give you that magical feeling all the other mediums of Harry Potter give you. That is not to say it’s a perfect game.Strengths: Audio is crisp. Looks amazing. A massive emphasis on sound and graphics. Spells are fun, feel good, and you will use all of them throughout the game in battles and to solve puzzles (more on puzzles later). Main quest is engaging, side quests have flushed out characters that you can connect with. Atmosphere. Probably the highlight of the game. Hogwarts feels spot on. The houses are all there, and you get to choose which one to join. My understanding is, this has a huge impact on gameplay and quests, but I only stuck with Slytherin, so I can’t personally confirm. The professors (although slightly different names probably for copyright reasons. I know it’s set 100 years in the past but still) and classes are there too. Whether you’re running to potions class or learning a new spell in defense of the dark arts class. Talking with students or hanging out in the common room drinking from a goblet while petting a cat or running off to the forbidden forest to fight a troll, it all just feels authentic to the books and movies. Nosey ghosts are running around the castle, the library holds plenty of secrets, the dinning hall, the courtyards. Moving statues, talking paintings, there are bits of trivia everywhere, and you get experience for exploring too. You really feel it, and that is a massive accomplishment for the studio to pull off.  Revelio is a spell that highlights everything interactable in an area. What a simple and genius idea. I cast it constantly and its super helpful. The whole time I was thinking, why this the first game to utilize this mechanic? Maybe it’s not but I couldn’t think of one, and certainly none have done it as well as Hogwarts Legacy.  Broom flying, fast travel, and a well detailed map are also all included as great quality of life additions.There are animals you can capture and breed, potions to find and make, plants that attack for you, gear upgrades, and a massive world to explore. Mob index, castle, and hamlet history. Hidden treasures everywhere. Definitely no lack of things to do. A few things hold this game back from being on my Mt. Rushmore of video games. Weaknesses:The bugs. I had quest bugs, I had audio bugs, I had looting bugs. Steam thought the game was still running long after I had quit. I had my game crash multiple times while fast traveling. I had a bug that took a quest mob ten minutes to spawn, and I couldn’t leave the area, or I would fail the quest, a main storyline quest. On two separate occasions I had to download new drives for my video card because this game kept locking up my whole system. I will also loop in the startup time to go along with the defects. This game takes a long time to start up. I mean a long time. I have a decent machine (SSD and Gforce TI 1050 graphics card) and on multiple occasions this game took no less than ten minutes to compile all the shaders. I like to think I’m a patient person, but this was pushing it, even for me. I understand that the graphics are great, but still.The second was mob variety. Goblins, spiders, and dark wizards make up 90% of all the mobs in this game. Maybe a future DLC or expansion will blow this open, but as it stands, too many repeat mobs with the same moves. It’s even more of a shame because they have so much lore to pool from. This is Harry Potter we are talking about. Dementors, Basilisks, all kinds of mobs could have been included, but instead you get to fight another spider boss that does the same thing all the other spiders do.Not everyone will agree with this next one, but there are just too many puzzles in this game. I would have liked to see them condense the puzzle count, make them more difficult, and more engaging, and give better loot. They are not all bad, some of the treasure maps were fun, but most are too similar to each other to add much to the game play. I don’t know the total amount of puzzles you could end up doing in this game, but it’s in the hundreds if not thousands. 95% of them give you a reward you will forget about two seconds after you get it. Not my favorite game mechanic and I didn’t like the direction this game went with it. Did I mention there are way too many puzzles? I’m looking at you Merlin Trials.    In closing, the game has a good play time. 50-60h for the main story line if you know what you're doing in this genre of video game. Probably 100h if you want to be a completionist. I debated doing everything 100%, but after I finished the main story line, and side quests, I realized I don’t have a desire to go for it. I don’t regret a second of my playtime though, but probably won’t do a round two. Plenty of Potter Heads will though, and that’s another testament to the quality of this game. And make no mistake, this is a quality game. A great choice if you’re looking to get away from sweaty nerds yelling at you in multiplayer.

author: IanOnATuesday
review: When this game was announced, it was my childhood dream come true. An open world RPG set in the Harry Potter universe where I can create my own character and attend Hogwarts? Sign me up! Only this isn't an RPG, and you spend only about a quarter of the game actually going to classes and exploring Hogwarts. Instead, the developers thought it would be a really great idea to have you spend the majority of the game exploring the same copy & pasted dungeons and mines while fighting the same 4 enemies (goblins, dark wizards, spiders, and these ancient knight things) with the occasional troll thrown in to spice things up. How fun! The few quests in this game that are genuinely exciting and fun to play through... wait for it... have nothing to do with fighting enemies in boring locales. Going to classes, learning spells, taming magical beasts, and exploring the depths of Hogwarts are all things that you can do in this game, and it's a blast to do them! But the amount of quests dedicated to doing these things is minuscule. Maybe I could get past the tedious gameplay if the story was good, but it's not. The main plot is just completely uninteresting, and the villain is never a real threat. Most of the side characters, with the exception of Sebastian, all have stilted dialogue and disappointing questlines as well. By the end of the game, I was just trekking through, hoping to get to the end and maybe see some kind of satisfying wrap up, but I couldn't even get that. The geniuses at Avalanche decided to lock the final cutscene behind a level requirement that, for most people, will be about 9ish levels above their current one after the final boss. That means you have to grind boring sidequests and hunt for field guide pages for another 5ish hours before you even get to technically "finish" the game. It's no wonder that the achievement you get for this has been unlocked by only 13% of players. This is the opposite of what I wanted from a Harry Potter based game, and I'm utterly disappointed in the final product of something I have been wanting since I was a kid.

author: Manders
review: This game brought a world that protected me as a child into one that I felt I was coming home.

author: Best Boi
review: I don't care about JKR. I care about the people who made this game. 10/10

author: Meowcabre
review: how inconvenient travel was before i invented floo powder

author: Gattsta
review: The game was a bunch of fun. There's a little something for everyone and on the harder difficulties the game actually makes you think when doing the fights. If you like Harry Potter at all, you'll love it, if you don't care for Harry Potter, you might enjoy the journey!

author: Depression
review: NO SPOILERS!! This has been hands down one of the best open world RPG games I have had the pleasure of playing! You are really missing out on a great video game experience if you don't give this game a try! You don't need to be a Harry Potter fan to understand what's happening - the game does a pretty good job giving you all the lore & getting you sucked into the story regardless. The combat has been the most fun, immersive, intense, & smoothest combat I've ever played - even if you suck you still feel like a powerful lil gamer throwing goblins around. YOU CAN FLY ON A BROOMSTICK?!?!? I have about 30 hours into the game & I've made little to no progress because there's SO MUCH to see & do & I'm not mad about it at all. In fact, I don't want this game to ever end! Each house gets a set of different quests - which is pretty cool! My BF & I started playing at the same time but we reached a point where we both started playing 2 different games/experiences. There's beautiful scenery no matter where you look! I wish character creation had a bit more freedom/options. You're stuck using a short list of presets, the hairstyles are kinda basic, not too many accessories (lots of nice clothing options tho!), & you can't change weight, height, specific nose/eye/facial structures. Just would like to be able to create more unique looking characters! Photomode is a NEED in a game as beautiful as this one! To add to the immersion - it would be cool to have animation to sit down places, poses for photomode (like cyberpunk has - their photomode is pretty OP), more accessories & you already know... Quidditch. If there are any DLC's in the future ... my money is already yours!!!!! I can't stop playing this game. Even when I'm not playing - I'm thinking about it non stop. It lives in my head rent free! Seriously, do yourself a favor & get this game. This game has temporarily cured my depression , lol. (not joking - im the happiest i've been in years right now). Thank you for making a game so full of magic & bringing a world we have all grown to love & find comfort in to life.

author: Ph0b0s
review: I am genuinely impressed. Hogwarts Legacy far exceeds the oh-so-low AAA bar by a mile by not just being a pretty stable game but a fun and kinda immersive one. For those of you deep in that Harry Potter lore, you won't be disappointed, and more importantly for those who don't know anything about the books or movies its still an enjoyable experience. Character creation and wand customization goes to an almost unreasonable amount of variety from your tone of voice to how floppy or rigid your wand is. Yes, you can set the size too...for all you who want to 12 plus inches of magic wood; now with all the wood jokes aside lets talk about combat. This game is an action RPG, one that rewards combos in combat almost as if taking a page out of Arkham along with counters for enemy attacks. Enemies sometimes shield themselves in a way specific spells are key to breaking through, so having variety in your applied spells is about as key as understanding how to combo and go all out on the enemy. The story...is decent. At the time of this review I had not completed it as I have had so much fun just checking out the sights of the massive open world. That said, the story isn't bad but as someone who knows the books some stuff feels kinda predictable yet fitting. You can make choices throughout the story and have different dialogues with npcs, but if there is one criticism I have for it is that it doesn't really have much weight or consequences to it. Its been fun exploring the castle and Forbidden forest, blasting through spiders and unleashing an unreasonable amount of fire on dark wizards. Definitely worth getting, if you are into action rpgs like this or are just a hardcore Potter fan that wants an immersive experience.

author: Uruk-hai
review: Hogwarts Legacy is a game that takes place in the magical world of Harry Potter and provides players with the opportunity to attend Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. However, despite its exciting setting, the game is limited in its overall experience. One of the biggest issues with the game is the lack of interaction with NPCs. The NPCs in the game are reminiscent of those found in early 2000s games, and they do not respond to player interactions in meaningful ways. This leads to a disconnect between the player and the world of Hogwarts, making it difficult to fully immerse oneself in the experience.Another problem with the game is the limited interactions available to the player. The player is able to cast spells and steal items, but these actions do not have significant consequences and the NPCs ignore these actions. This lack of consequences and reactions from the NPCs takes away from the game's realism and immersion.You won't find a rich and dynamic environment to explore and interact with in this game. Instead, you'll find a world that feels static and unresponsive to your actions. If you're looking for an open world game with expansive gameplay options, I would definitely recommend skipping Hogwarts Legacy.

author: roflwaffles
review: I had high hopes and played this game a lot before making up making up my mind - but the game ignores too much of what is core to the wizarding world for me to recommend it.Some of the reasons I cannot recommend this game:- Gear/Skill System - you can't even cast arresto momentum on  in this game are very simple and exclude much of the magic from the Harry Potter world - forget the extension charm from Hermione's bag along with so much more!- Game doesn't run properly on recommended system/specs- The cryptarch is back as a desk.- Pressing left on the dpad is a terrible way to explore the world and is detrimental to the exploration/puzzle engagement in many instances - felt like a cheap way to make the game more accessible- The name you were forced to enter isn't on your invitation letter to Hogwarts - and subsequently is pretty much only used in subtitle text (I haven't seen my name elsewhere).- They have you read about too many potion ingredients instead of using them- Quidditch not being in the game was blamed on a character in the game...not the broken broom mechanic- They don't tell a quality story with proper character development and clear goals/progress/resolution. Characters remain an enigma throughout making it difficult to form any bonds and clearly identify you own personal stake in the story and core story elements are left incompletely explained.  Forget the keepers being hypocrites saying we have to hurry and still making me wait.- The story is on rails - you have 0 effect on what people do and just stand there in cut scenes as things happen the way the developers want regardless of the implications of your conversation choices OR learning dark magic.- Professor Weasly @ ~60% wizard field guide completion: "You still have a ways to go."   Professor Weasly @ 100% wizard field guide completion: "You still have a ways to go."- Every time I collect a Fwooper - "Professor Fig will never believe this!"- Fast travel system every time I get too close - something dumb and repetitive like - "You won't believe how inconvenient travel was before I invented floo powder."  Like apparition or brooms haven't existed or you haven't ever told me that before.- More questions then answers after finishing the story- Can't even swim underwater - no gillyweed or charms to add that kind of "depth" to the game...part of the gear/skill system problem- Locking map objectives / puzzles to quests - like the depulso challenges or cabinet keys that float around - this is not conducive to the world being explored naturally.  I spent better part of an hour trying to figure out the depulso room entrance only to find out the entry button spawns after you get the quest.  Terrible!!!- Holds your hand hard...I mean super hard.  And in the wrong way...see my last point.- Can I not fight dragons?  Where is my dragon heartstring?  Where is my wandmaking or charming magic ability...where is making potions like that first time in potions class...where is anything that makes this game more interesting than both standing on the shoulders of Harry Potter and half decent combat you pulled from the Batman Arkham games?This lack of proper thematic mechanic design, lack of polish and lack of story leaves me feeling so empty after finishing this game.  Had the story pulled it's weight then most of these issues wouldn't of mattered as much but here I am.Reasons I can recommend:- Good graphics (not great - too much fog and LOD/lighting issues especially in far away terrains/textures -needs work in many places)- You can explore the castle/hogsmeade/world (if you are a HP fan just walking around is a treat)- Combat is engaging on a basic level- Easy to learn - good level design for beginnersTLDR:They needed to spend more on designers, writers and testers.  Emphasis on the first two.  The game is about 40-50% what it should have been.  In it's current state I call it: Hogwarts of Arkham: Breath of the Destiny...which is probably giving this game more credit than it deserves.

author: antidotcb
review: Hogwarts Legacy is a good game, although it may not be considered exceptional or groundbreaking. However, it delivers an intense beginning to the story, with enjoyable levels of fan-service that reference the Harry Potter and Fantastic Beasts movies. The game's overall atmosphere is positive, and it benefits from almost flawless technical implementation, a rare feat in today's gaming industry.One of the game's strengths is its strong combat mechanics, which start simple but become more complex and engaging as the game progresses. The graphical design and art style are also impressive, especially at extreme settings at 4K, although a decent PC is required to run the game this way.On the downside, the game suffers from repetitiveness and an overabundance of points of interest on the map, which can feel like mere placeholders after a while. The Merlin trials also feel lackluster, and the caves and camps become monotonous after the middle game. These factors contribute to the game feeling like a grind, which may not be appealing to non-diehard fans of the series. The sound and music also become repetitive, which can be a turn-off.The most significant technical problem is the difficulty in focusing on enemies or objects when there are many on the screen. The user interface could also be more user-friendly, with features like a "Sell All" button or the ability to buy multiple potions at once.Despite these flaws, there is potential for interesting story-based DLCs in other locations, which could make for an enjoyable gaming experience.

author: Nazarid
review: I am enjoying a video game I paid for. It's got some minor issues, but if you enjoy the Harry Potter world this will be a fun experience for you. Combat is decent but not amazing, the difficulty settings do not allow the game to be hard enough for an average gamer. The game keeps surprising me as I get thru the content(just keeps getting bigger). The story wont be winning any prizes but is a fair and average heroin trial type story. Mobility is good, the coder of the broom controls should never code anything flying again(who adds flying to a game without proper mouse movement controls?) The insane people who are harassing people for just playing the game, you need help(grow up).

author: Pla5ma
review: Look, I get it. You guys have been starved for a new open world to explore for a good hot minute but this is nowhere near GOTY. Great game in its own right sure but just wait until Starfield. If you're a big fan of Harry Potter or magic for its own sake then yes, this is a game you want. Nice, pretty open world to explore but limited in its features and secrets. If you want to explore Hogwarts then DEFINITELY get this. Truly a love letter to the fans of the Potterverse. The devs did an incredible job of bringing Hogwarts to life. While most of the rewards are either cash or cosmetics, exploring is alright. Flying is ridiculously good.Devs and warner bros reckon this entry won't be the first Potterverse game so while there is absolutely room for improvement, it's a nice game to screw around in for a bit and have a great deal of fun. Much to look forward to in the future.

author: POSIT1C
review: 𝐦𝐚𝐬𝐭𝐞𝐫𝐩𝐢𝐞𝐜𝐞, that would be my short answer to this game.To start this review, let me say that even though it is based on the films and books, it is definitely not a necessity to have watched/read them. This review will be my experience of playing the game as someone who grew up with the films/books.𝐖𝐨𝐫𝐥𝐝:The world is structured like most open worldpgs I've played, lots of sights (camps, caves, dungeons and more) to explore. The world never really felt empty this way and there was always something to go to. This game also has many easter eggs and experiences, I regularly discovered new things even when I had completed all quests.𝐀𝐭𝐦𝐨𝐬𝐩𝐡𝐞𝐫𝐞:The atmosphere is great, there were many moments when I was just standing in hogsmeade and hogwarts and listening to all the people's stories or just wandering around hunting for new secrets. The developers did a great job with the effects/music and details, they really made the game feel alive.𝐬𝐭𝐨𝐫𝐲:The story is OK, it just didn't really click for me. What kept me coming back to this game were the side missions/mysteries.I really liked that they gave you a storyline per person and there were even some storylines that I liked more than the main storyline.I liked that they rewarded you for completing side missions (they gave new spells as rewards).That made it that there was a reason to complete them.𝐀𝐜𝐡𝐢𝐞𝐯𝐞𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐬:This game is perfect for people who like chasing achievements, the achievements are not too hard to get and are actually fun. There are about 603 collectibles to collect if you want to reach 100% and is easy to do in 60 hours of game time.𝐂𝐨𝐧𝐜𝐥𝐮𝐬𝐢𝐨𝐧:This game is a great choice if you want hours of entertainment/new achievements to grind for. I would recommend this game for the people who are a fan of big open world RPGs and for the people who loved the books/movies.𝐇𝐚𝐯𝐞 𝐟𝐮𝐧!

author: Morningstar
review: So here's the thing- the situation is extremely complex. Mentioning the game without mentioning the creator of it's IP is impossible due to her- dumb-ass-ery.I'm a trans person, I didn't participate in the boycott. Because, I realize, that in seeking allies, it's a bad idea to run around telling people what they can and can't do, and just be overall belligerent on the internet to the point where we annoy everyone else. We need all the allies we can get, and telling people that THEM enjoying their childhood media, no matter how mediocre those films and books are, that their enjoyment of those things is WRONG is not going to get them on our side. It'll push them further away.The itself game is great. JK Rowling maybe gets a dollar or two in royalties per copy, (and she has already made her money either way, with or without the boycott.) if you feel bad for buying the game because she's getting royalties from it, just donate like 5$ to an LGBT+ charity. Idk, I feel like it balances out.Also, you can literally choose your pronouns in the character creator, which shows the devs don't align themselves with Rowlings ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥.To all the overzealous allies who are spoiling the game for others, or harassing strangers for playing a damn video game: I appreciate the enthusiasm, but you don't represent all of us, and you especially don't represent me. A measured response is needed here. And you're not it.This game is well worth your money. The world is beautiful; I often find myself avoiding fast travelling all-together and *walking* through the world just taking it all in. Most of the characters are well written, I enjoy their individual stories, and have, so far, gone out of my way to experience every side quest I come across. The gameplay is responsive, and combat is simple, yet engaging, as each spell has a unique outcome depending on which enemies you use them on during a fight. The soundtrack is incredible, and conveys the feelings of any given situation at appropriate times. I know the year just started, but I fully believe this game deserves GOTY, or at least a nomination for it.  I hope those of you that are enjoying the game, continue to enjoy it. I'm going for 100%. Have fun!

author: What?
review: Great game, a good mix of Bully and Red Dead with some Skyrim tossed in. This is something more people should play and less people should whine about.

author: Moh
review: Shut up and get this game.

author: Bunnerkins
review: I really wanted to love this game, but I find playing it to be such a chore. It looks like an RPG, but it doesn't play like one. There are rich people and places, but no meaningful way to interact with them. Overall the game is painstakingly mid. It feels like two teams handed in a group project, and one of the teams did a phenomenal job, and the other team ♥♥♥♥ the bed hard. The team that made the world, A+. Absolutely hit it out of the park. The world is beautiful, it is thoughtful, it is full and vibrant. It looks and feels lived in. The team that decided how we interact with that world, ooof. Huge miss. Hogwarts Legacy feels like a missed opportunity.

author: Sev3nBelow
review: Pros -->Incredible environments and scenery.Really fun combat system / Spell-casting.Grow your own Plants / Brew potions.Beast catching minigame that ties into crafting.Genuinely feels like you're in the Hogwarts universe.Suprisingly forgot about the main harry potter story while playing - It feels familiar and at the same time fresh and new.No ' Live Service' Game model.No Battlepass / Timed cosmetic pass / no FOMOCons -->No proper Ultra-wide Support. Quite a lot of cut scenes - the black bars are annoying.Stuttering for days / FPS Drops Needs some optimisation - Seems like you need a real beefy system  for good peformance.No pausing dialogue / cutscenes.No quidditch - really ?Verdict --> A Must buy for Harry Potter fans, Wait for some patches if you are uninterested in the hogwarts universe.

author: SheeshXP
review: Better then I imagined the game would be by a mile honestly game of the year from me and its only February!

author: SppuDy
review: Will remain negative until performance issues are fixed for PC

author: DustyBadSkillz
review: For the love of all that's important to you, please give us a pause during cutscenes. Some of us can hold it in for only so long.

author: Snow White
review: I may have clicked the thumbs down, that is because the game's ratings have been blown out of proportion. It is definitely not terrible, but it does NOT deserve "very positive" reviews. Mixed, at best.++++ Hogwarts+++ Sebastian++ Overall design of the world, and the story is pretty allright for as much as I've been playing+ Daily prophet in Hogsmeade - I wish I could collect all of those. Loved the Dricken story.+ resource gathering. It's quick and you get plenty of stuff for potions just by going on your quests without teleporting.+ Combat is very nice, feels very natural. Troll fights and boss fights do need reflexes, although I have yet to fight a non-troll on Hard mode. I do not expect to be disappointed though.- Too grindy and repetitive- Buggy as for now. Laggy. Why give me the option to play with RTX when 40fps is going to be the norm in a top-shelf gaming PC in certain areas?- World too big for the amount of quests it has. I do not need to travel the whole map to enjoy the game, I'd rather have 1 Hogwarts and 1 Hogsmeade. Not.... 15 Hogsmeades.- Repetitive Hogwarts/student interactions. Dialogues feel repetitive and it can get boring.-  uncomfortable spell UI. I want more than 4 spells on my bar, in fact, give me all 9, I've been gaming since I was 10. I'm 27. I can click more than 4 buttons.---- just too ducking repetitive. Unskippable 81 Merlin Trials (Instead of making a cut-scene, I'd much rather see it from a player perspective). Boring caves. Alohomora locks minigame (Ugh!). Definitely needs, if not a part 2, then at least some DLCs. Companion DLC - I am LOOKING at you. When I buy an AAA game, I expect CONTENT. Grind is NOT content. It is your way to call it a day after getting my money. And don't get me started on the amount of Demiguises you have to get for Mr Moon. Just. No.---- Let's be real. Most players of Hogwarts legacy are 25+ and live grindy lives with grindy jobs grinding excel sheets. And you sell me a grindy game so that I can grind after I grind, because I haven't been grinding enough. Thanks.

author: SirMuffins
review: 22 hours in and I dont seem to have even scratched the surface with the games main story and the exploration which is possible with this game. This game is a Harry Potters dream come true and theres so many easter eggs which I have already found and I look forward to finding more. Even if youre not a Harry Potter fan this is a 10/10 RPGWhen i played in early access I got alot of frame stutters which seem to have now been fixed by the new geforce update. I don't have that good a PC so thats something to bare in mind. Even with the stutters I had an amazing time with the game.The game is immersive, the characters are realistic and loveable and the world is just as magical as the movies and books.

author: Nana
review: The first time a massive HP video game in the series lives up to the expectation. All the details and exploration within Hogwarts are just as we imagined 20 years ago. As an avid RPG player, sometimes the game is not all about combat, but the liveliness of the exploration is the main factor in the game. This game nailed it in that part, even though the combat can be repetitive, but hope the exploration part just makes us forget about the particular combat aspect. Worth every penny for the deluxe edition, and btw bullying the player because they didn't get to the same political movement as you is a dumb move. You yourself are no other than the bully that did before you.

author: TheCyberDruid
review: The game is very good, but it isn't without flaws. It's a really well made open-world RPG-ish action adventure. If you ilke Harry Potter this game delivers exactly what you think it will (and more). Sadly with raytracing it does stutter a lot (at least on a 3070). Without it it runs fine. Also the achievement design is quite grindy. There's also a problem with one of the 46 quests that prevents you from completing the game 100% without messing with save files (that is after the game is out for about 4 weeks).I had a great time playing the game, but if you want to get all achievements in the game it can be rather frustrating. Overall a great game and certainly worth getting if you are a Potter-head.

author: Arkhadius
review: With over 100 hours in, I'm thoroughly enjoying this game. The story is very engaging, the graphics are great and it's surprisingly stable for a new release. Admittedly, I'm not a big Harry Potter fans. Read the books once more than 10 years ago, seen the movies once or twice on video and I can see it rewarding 'real' fans of the Potterverse without punishing those of us who aren't.

author: Whitapod
review: When I bought this game, it was marketed as an "action RPG." Despite this description, Hogwarts Legacy is not an RPG. You cannot make significant decisions in this game, you cannot be evil in this game, you can do little to effect the course of the gameplay. you have like two choices in dialogue for each encounter. This game also has horrible optimization issues, and barely runs at times. Additionally, there is little enemy variety, and you can cheese your way through most encounters. If you like fetch quests, get this game because there are a ton of them! Otherwise, I would steer clear or wait for it to go on sale. I was super excited for this one, and the final product left me sorely disappointed.

author: doodlepigs
review: First of all, I am giving a down vote for just two reason, Denuvo and the horrible performance and frame rate drop on PC. To be fair is it NOT TOTALLY unplayable but it definitely is a sub par experience, considering I have already reduced the video to mid-high AND it is still dropping frame rate to almost 10- 20 on many occasions. That is on my PC with 3080 Nvidia and AMD Ryzen 9 3900X 12-Core Processor 3.79 GHz and also 32 GB system memory!I suspect the need to include the lousy denuvo code definitely plays a part, since all games that have denuvo tend to have a bit of problem, as its ♥♥♥♥♥♥ code seems very difficult to include on the dev's own code without impacting performance in some way. On the other hand, the game is also likely not optimised to the PC hardware as well.As for the game itself, it is a very good game and thoroughly enjoyable. The characters is fleshed out, the quests are generally well designed even if some are repetitive and the world is buzzing. One thing though, do not expect your choice to have any significance .. or even to be given much choices in any way. treat it like a typical console game than a true blue PC RPG game and you won't experience some dissonance in terms of expectation and reality.I will change the rating to yes, if and when they patch the performance issue out AND remove denuvo.

author: Huggo Wuggo
review: TLDR:  Excellent game!  9.5 / 10 --- A must play if you are a fan of the series.  Very immersive, detailed, and engaging gameplay.  After fully completing the game and unlocking everything, I wanted to keep going!  I hope there will be more DLC in the future.  Highly recommend.----- No Spoilers -----NPCs: One of the things I enjoyed most about playing through this game was the commentary from the NPCs.  The devs did a wonderful job giving them tons of dialogue and tailoring the lines to your progress in the story.  It created a truly immersive atmosphere and kept things fresh.  I also like all the background dialogue that can be overheard in the game, much of which is quite funny if you stop and listen.  The game feels very alive.Puzzles & Platforming: I thought the puzzles and platforming aspects were good with some being better than others.  I liked that not all areas could be solved right away, allowing me to return later when I had the appropriate tools to complete everything fully.  Combat:  I really enjoy the fighting aspect of this game!  In the beginning, I found combat challenging and it was evident that a controller was what it was designed around.  I eventually remapped some keys to make it a bit less frustrating and I became more comfortable performing sick combos.  The combat is a strong aspect in this game.Stories:  I thought the stories told were actually pretty good and better than some of the more recent Harry Potter films *cough Fantastic Beasts*.  I hope there will be more DLC in the future to expand on this narrative and timeline in the Harry Potter gaming universe.Customization: The Room of Requirement is awesome.  You have a ton of control over your spaces and I was blown away by how much you could do in there (it was really unexpected).  I also like that you can control your appearances while wearing the best gear. I highly recommend this game.

author: Layla Spellwind
review: SPOILER FREE REVIEW!Yes, absolutely buy this game. It's super fun and there's lots to explore!The game has a few bugs, but nothing overly awful. Usually reloading will fix the issue. Or an exit and re-open. It's annoying, but the developers will no doubt be fixing things in time!There's mostly a lot of silly annoying bugs. Like leaving hogsmeade and your character saying "Hogsmeade here I come!" No... we just left there, you silly twit!I should note, I only recommend this game if you are Ravenclaw, like me. Otherwise you should go elsewhere. We don't need you gaining house points for your lesser houses.But it's worth noting, house points don't seem to be a thing unfortunately. The game doesn't focus on the school a whole lot, there's no quidditch, there's very few classes and as said, no house points.But there's an upside to this. The game focuses on the Wizarding World. The universe around the school. You can explore the Forbidden Forest, or even go further a field. I won't say too much, you'll have to see for yourself!You'll be absolutely BLASTED with nostalgia, at every turn. And if you're anything like me. You'll love every minute of it.I would however warn fellow arachnophobes, that there is no option to turn the spiders off, and they can be pretty yikesy!Now, the finally point. The drama around this game. I didn't want to have to talk about this. But people make it damn near impossible to avoid. I am trans, it's an intrinsic part of who I am. There is representation in the game, and I have a friend, who has a friend, who is a story writer for the game. Apparently he's having issues with his kidneys. I suspect this game doing so well might save his life. Why am I talking about this mans kidneys? Because it's important to note, that even if you don't like JK Rowling, the success of this game impacts more than just her.I disagree with things she's said. I dislike things she encourages. I hate transphobia. But. This is a good game, made by good developers. And she's already rich. So please, if you don't want to buy the game yourself, that's totally okay. Just don't harass anyone who does. You do trans people no favours. You are not an ally to trans people if you do this.Because you just make us more enemies.There's also a trans character. Which some people say is "virtue signalling". I disagree. It's a great risk on the behalf of the developers to include a trans character. In a game that's mostly going to be played by JK Rowling supporters. The world needs more love.Now, I've left comments off. But not just for the obvious reason. I want to avoid any negativity I can. And prevent others from seeing angry commenters too.Just know, that regardless of who you are. I love you, I want you all to have a lovely day and I hope that you get to live a life without hate.P.s. You can pet cats. <3

author: Starkine
review: It took me a while to write this review, because I wanted more context, after +70 hours of gameplay (normal mode), here are my thoughts:- True open world: You can explore almost everywhere without limitation, whether walking or flying.- Very immersive, sounds and graphics were better than I expected.- Character customization is ok, but not the best I've seen. What surprised me here is the variety of clothing items throughout the game.- Great achievement's system in game AND on Steam. If you're also a person who gets hyped because of those, you'll enjoy it!- Great adaptation of the books to the game. Excellent references of characters, items, places and other things.- - - Main quest: I expected more from the story itself. For me, it was very easy to predict the path I would take after the third trial.- - Side quests: Some are often more fun/complex to do than the main quest itself. I didn't mind focusing on other stuff than the main quest itself lol - Controls during battle: The spell shortcuts are pretty bad, I had to reconfigure them to get better gameplay.- Enemies: Some are much easier than others even the ones who supposedly to be stronger, - I bought the deluxe version for early access, but I was disappointed with the additional content released, I don't think it was worth it. I hope that the same quests released exclusively for PS5 will also be included in the future.- URGENTLY needs better optimization.In general, I think it's worth to play it but keep in mind that, if you're used to this type of genre, you may need to adjust your expectations to the limitations. I'll be looking forward for the future updates and new addicional contents as well.

anymore your first run through of all places feels good seeing everything the first time then when you come back its almost lifeless npc dont have anything to say other than like 4 scripted sentences the teachers of the school just stand in there room looking at the wall with no dialogue the Headmaster is no where ever to be seen you can never have a conversation with a student unless its one of the people from the group your put in the school with AND SAYING STUDENT IS BAD OF ME this game feels like there is no students at all other then inside the halls of the school In cutscenes in the class in the class at all ever in the ending there is always only 5 or 6 students you arent in this massive house with a bunch of students your in a dorm with like 6 people that you will see your whole entire playthrough Another big issue I have with this game is the lack of world interaction I found a snow man that would throw snowballs at me once that was preety cool other than that the most you can interact with in this world is shoot paintings with your wand  spin globes and drink tea and eat candy no talking with npcs no way to sit down and look apart of the enviroment there is no way to get cool screenshots and photos of this game because its always your weird ass npc standing in the middle of the room while everyone stands there saying the same thing that they literally always ever seen in my life like the story for alot of the characters and events that take place in this game are so just horrible like this writing is purely lvl 1 of story telling whoever wrote these storys needs to spend there talent points in story telling the DECEPTIVE way they told us we can be dark wizards in this game is a actual joke like I really cant believe they tried to spin this as a choose your path game when you literally have 2 choices in dialogue the whole game the good guy and the inconsiderate guy that has 0 effect your relationship or anything for that matter with anyone you can get 3 unforgivable curses so the extent of your "DARK WIZARD" gameplay was to be a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ to people when they speak to me and be able to shoot green colored animations at people like its really upsetting to me how devoid of magic this game is essentially the rpg formula of a game that branded them selves with one of the most popular storys ever told to sell a rpg with the visualization of the harry potter universe I set out to 100% this game before it even released under the COPIUM that it was the harry potter experience I have always wanted I got that for 4 hours maybe and then it all left me I like the game and its probably great for people who have very minimal experience with rpgs but for me It was just another rpg in another world but this time it was based around one of the closet storys to home for me this game is a 6/10 it ran so ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ horribly It should get 5/10 but ill look over performance issues on this one sense I was able to atleast finish the game = buy it, its a great game until you decide that you want to complete everything alot of the hours this game points at saying you can get out of it are really just regular rpg author: Electric Sausage
review: I honestly can't praise this game enough for how well it fully immerses you into the world. From just how many little secrets and mysteries you come across in Hogwarts castle itself to Hogsmeade always feeling warm and welcoming along with the picturesque countryside you fly through on either broom or magical beast.Gameplay wise it plays well, with fast and responsive attacks and spells. Most of the skill for this will come in your ability to quickly swap between your different sets of spells. It does come with a learning curve, but nothing too harsh that can't be adapted to. Pair that with the use of magical tools and the potion crafting and gear upgrade system you'll be able to easily dominate most foes if you use all of the tools at your disposal.Now at the moment of writing this review I have yet to finish the main story, but it has so far been gripping enough that I enjoy it. Most of the characters you come across are also at worst, bearable. Though I've ended up putting most of my hours in to simply exploring, doing side quests and expanding my magical beast collection, not even into the winter season just yet.Finally we come to the music, which is simply enchanting. It remains familiar to the soundtrack from the Harry Potter movies I'm sure a lot of us grew up watching, but still has it's own distinct sound. Almost like it's more primal at times, with the occasional recognisable notes played throughout.I wold wholeheartedly recommend this game to anyone who has been eagerly awaiting a new Harry Potter game. Despite all the drama and such around the game itself, and my own misgivings towards J.K. Rowling, the devs behind this game deserve your money.

author: Dezzenter
review: Hogwart's Legacy is a beautiful, magical game that will surely delight fans of the Harry Potter saga. At first glance, it is clear that the developers have paid great attention to detail and created an amazing world full of mysteries and extraordinary places. The graphics are stunning and captivating, and the music perfectly captures the atmosphere of the magical school of wizards.The game also offers an intriguing storyline in which the player becomes a student at Hogwarts and uncovers the secrets of the castle and its surrounding world. The gameplay is full of challenges and diverse tasks that provide many hours of fun.

author: Sevotius
review: After having 100%-ed the game with all achievements in tow, I can say with confidence that Hogwarts Legacy is a  game. Not groundbreaking, not genre-defining, not revolutionary but certainly good. This is no Witcher 3 or Red Dead Redemption 2. However, I'm hoping this is just the beginning.1. Performance issues. For a game that doesn't look particularly outstanding, it can sure be taxing on your PC, especially the ray-tracing. Glad to see the devs dropping some quick patches though.2. The open world outside of Hogwarts is both large and unengaging. There's not a lot of interesting things to do and completing every Merlin Trial, popping every balloon, landing on every platform, finding every field guide etc. is such a chore. It doesn't help that the map actually doesn't show all of these locations forcing you to "Revelio" your way to it.3. Revelio. I hate it when games have only one good way of discovering points of interest and loot and you're forced to just mindlessly spam it all the time. Sure I could stop doing it and actually observe things for a change but with the hundreds of things to interact with, I simply don't have the time to actually *look* at the world. This to me is a failure of game design and an artificial method of bloating play time.4. Bad loot. Your gear, while visually appealing, only serves to add some stats. And since you can transmogrify everything, you have absolutely no attachment to anything you find. Also after a certain point, around midgame for me, there's nothing to spend your money on.5. Museum world. You can't interact with most NPCs, most items and most locations forcing you to just look but not touch.6. Combat camera. I've been fiddling with the camera for a while and it just doesn't feel right. Lock-on and targeting feels clunky overall.7. Side quests. There are so few side quests in this game. Some of the best moments in open world RPGs for me happen when you stumble unto something wholly unexpected yet gratifying. Unfortunately, that doesn't really happen in Hogwarts Legacy.8. School life. You barely interact with fellow students, your teachers or your classes. Attending Hogwarts feels less like going to school and more like Witcher Lite since you're spending most of your time fighting monsters in the wild.9. Half baked RPG mechanics. Rudimentary dialogue options and skill points does not an RPG make.10. Alohomora. What's the point in having a lockpicking game when the entire purpose of this spell is to literally unlock everything?1. Hogwarts. Even though you barely interact with it, Hogwarts itself is a feast for the eyes. Multi-storied and multi-dimensional with lots of hallways and stairs weaving in and out, it's a joy to simply explore this grand institution.2. Music. The music has all the charm and whimsy of the movies and is absolutely delightful.3. The Room of Requirement. While it's annoying listening to Deek for the hundredth time, the actual room and especially the vivarium is fantastic. I'd love a DLC that expands upon care of magical beasts.4. Intriguing main story. While the ending didn't quite hit all marks for me, I still enjoyed how the plot unfolded and the new lore it adds to the Wizarding World.5. Relationship quests. Natsai's was...fine. Poppy's was genuinely pretty fun. Sebastian's had some artificial character conflicts IMO but was by far the most engaging. I was actually more interested in it than the main story lol. Just one question: why is Ravenclaw the only House that doesn't have a relationship quest attached to it?6. Tight combat. Yes, the camera is funky but the actual combat is the tried and tested (and immensely fun) Arkham/Shadow of War model. Love it.7. Budding mod scene. There's already some great content there like expanded vendors and performance fixes. Seeing a lot of potential here.8. Puzzles. I always enjoy a good puzzle and Hogwarts seems like especially fertile ground for such things. Glad that the devs made a few interesting ones.9. Great cast of characters. I genuinely liked pretty much all the cast, with the exception of the villains, and I just wished for more interaction with all of them.10. Lots of detail. Whether it be suits of armor battling it out, a portrait giving you a wink or a ghost asking another for a dance, there are tons of little interactions to enjoy for the eagle-eyed.With all that out of the way, I'll repeat my notion that this game is indeed, objectively, pretty good. Really hoping there are DLCs/expansions/sequels in the pipeline since the MC is just a 5th year, there could potentially even be a trilogy some day. If the devs can fix those issues and double down on those strengths, I imagine there's a future masterpiece on the horizons.PS: Concerning the controversy that's been going on, yes, I'm sure JK Rowling is getting all them sweet sweet doubloons, no, she does not deserve to be supported, but hey, she's so astronomically rich anyway that the royalties from this game would be pennies for her. Also there's literally an awesome trans character in the game and I'm sure the idea of that would make JK Rowling froth at the mouth with rage. All in all, it ain't much but it's something.

author: Lorien
review: 40 hours through the main quest and all companion side quests, and no bugs or performance issues except for my cape ending up on the front of the character a couple of times. Good value for the money, and an appropriately finished game on release day. Sad to say: this should be the norm, but it isn't.Other than that: good graphics, nice but sometimes repetitive music design. Battles weren't too challenging, but entertaining. No feeling of "grind" or repetitiveness after 40 hours. Finishing the field guide might lead to frustration, let's see whether I will continue on that journey.

author: MoZeDK
review: Well the game overall I like, and do recommend. I have finished the game and trying to find some differences in the second play, and haven't found that much difference yet so replay ability is a bit low at the momentI will try to keep this as much a possible spoiler freeThe story:I think it is a bit bland, and not really that good. To many story lines more or less from the book/movie, so if you like me, have read and watched them, you kinda able to figure out what is going to happen with big parts of the game.Some of the side quests are decent like Sebastian.A bit to much on rails where you can't effect it to much, for my taste.Some of the blandness ties in to the characters in it that is not that interesting, and for me differently feels a bit out of place as this is set 1890'sMost of them is not that memorable, though did as stated before find Sebastian a good story, poppy a bit to.I would have liked to see more impact from the player on the story and a new story and not borrowed as much from the already told onceThe world:This is pretty nicely crafted world with lots of places to see and explore, and here it does grep some of the magic I find.Hogwarts is nicely done a rather big the first time around, you can get lost if you like me took away most of the hud and tried to find around my self, this I found pretty awesome.Hogsmeade is also pretty nice, thought it thought it would be a bit bigger but that is okey.The small hamlets is also pretty nice, and lots of small dungeons, camps and other POI'sNice to have a broom to get around to see the spots, though a little bit of annoyance when flying on mounts like the hippogriff's I haven't found a way to "auto" fly like on the broom. It is a big place after all, and I really do like the creatures in the game.Gameplay/combat:I like that is pretty easy to get into but can be a bit harder to master, might want a harder difficulty.Stringing some of the combo's in succession  feels pretty good, also that you can use plants is nice and a bit funny at times.There are different mechanics that are really nice once you have master them or get more comfortable with them.The amount of different enemies you encounter, is a big to low/not varied  enough so you see to much the same thing at times.A little annoying  you can't reset your talent points, have to think before using them, this is primary for the first play through, but as I do not see much replay ability as of yet, hence why I think it is a bit annoying.The magic:Well at places it does capture the magic like with the world as a whole.Though there is a lot of inconsistency with the lore. e.g. you are sent at time early in the game in to the forbidden forest even though it is "forbidden", the use of the unforgivable curses etc. This might have worked better if you where an adult.They also loose me a bit with the classes, not that interesting, could have used a bit more work in my opinion.The magical beasts is pretty nice and gets some of the feeling of the world really good.Some of the magic is lost with the characters as mentioned, as they are a big boring and misplaces at times.NPC can also seem a bit to "static" not sure that is the correct word.Why do I recommend the game, well it has in my opinion a good openworld explorations for people that like the  J.K. Rowling Harry Potter world.It also have a decent combat/gameplay with lots of nuances to play your own style, that makes the game fun to try to master.So overall I like the game and recommend it, though I think it was a bit over hyped.

author: Chinese Spy Balloon
review: 60 hours into the game, I can say for sure that it is worth $59.99. Content - 9/10 * Many side-quests located throughout the game world. * Story-Rich Main Quest Line and great motion capped cut-scenes comparable to the movies. (MAKE SURE TO HAVE CORRECT AUDIO PRESET OR MOUTH MOVEMENTS DURING SPEECH WILL BE MISALIGNED.) * Combat is fluid and creative, allowing for players to be creative with their spell combinations.* The game launched with 20+ Spells.* Missing Quidditch - There is a completely built out Quidditch pitch on Hogwarts grounds though, so I imagine the devs either delayed that part of the game or are planning on DLC.* Lore Rich - If you read any of the books, so many rich details within just Hogwarts alone that align with the films and books.* Character Customization - Detailed, but unable to edit face details like games like Skyrim would. Plenty of gear and fashion items that can be earned through challenges or completing activities in the game world. It took over twenty hours of looting and game-play to receive a duplicate item. * Challenges & Progression that align with extra un-lockables that can be used as cosmetic upgrades as you progress throughout the game. *Complex & Interesting Crafting & Hideout Mechanics that allow you to customize your own personal areas.* The game took inspiration from the Fantastic Beasts movies as-well, without spoiling in game features, that's all I will say. Map 10/10 - Hogwarts & Hogsmead are both immense with many places to explore. 60 hours in and I have not found all of the loot, books, or foo-flames within Hogwarts & Hogsmead.The World Map is Huge - Including Hogwarts & Hogsmead, currently as I know of, the world map has 14 regions for the player to explore. There are small and big details everywhere around the map. Unlike some other open world games that don't pack the empty spaces between activities, this game has filled them with puzzles and other activities. Movement & Combat - 8/10 Combat feels very fluid and natural, I play on Keyboard & Mouse and still enjoying casting spell combos and trying out different ones. I can't speak for controller players as I have not tried it, but I imagine it can't be bad. Character movement can be clunky at times, I suspect this is an issue with K&B, making your character seem flinchy or hard to control at sometimes, but is easy to master a couple hours in. Voice-Acting - 7/10 There are some moments where I think the devs had run out of voice-actors and just pitched down others voices to make more, as some voices of NPCs who may not be very important to the main story-line can sound robotic or electronically changed in someway. Otherwise, all of the main characters, and the players characters voice acting is great. There are characters that actually draw you deeper into the world and make you care about some of them or actually want to know more about their character. Music - 10/10 Normally in most games, the music slider always gets put to zero, but you will have a hard time doing that in this game with a great soundtrack reminiscent of Harry Potter &some songs from that series as-well.Performance - 9/10 SPECS -ASUS TUF X470AMD Ryzen 5 2600 OC'd @ 3.6 32GB RAMRTX 3050GRAPHICAL PRESET:All ULTRA - 55-60 FPS Avg. Ray Tracing seems to be bugged - or NVIDIA needs to drop a driver update on Feb 10th with the full release of the game,but with Ray Tracing enabled there are times where there are insane FPS stutters, but usually fix themselves in 2-3 seconds. Keep in mind, this could be my own bottleneck, or the game.I have noticed FPS drops in the game world are apparent during especially effect heavy areas in the game-world like the forbidden forest or some areas within Hogwarts. I have noticed while bench-marking performance, during these areas, the game does not pull enough memory away from what is available, in both VRAM and RAM.   This can be partly solved by increasing the process priority in task manager. Devs will have to do more work in optimization in this regard. All in all, we should all be happy about a completely playable, game-breaking bug free and complete-content filled game from a AAA studio with a stable release.

author: ScarletStreak
review: Combat is surprisingly the best part. Played with a controller, combat on Hard difficulty is challenging but feels rewarding. There's the usual dodge, block and perfect block which is satisfying to pull off. Deflecting multiple casts and utilizing every combat spell is extremely fun. Spells are designed to be chained to exploit opponent's weaknesses. Dark arts spells are optional but powerful, they really spice things up and makes the protagonist an unbeatable machine. Potions and plants are a very welcome addition to combat. Stealth is also a nice touch which makes use of invisibility and a unique spell for takedown.The story revolves around an ancient magic which is tied to the protagonist. It is a decent story but made enjoyable by the cast. There are interesting quests in there but there's one which really stands out. You'll know which one I'm talking about, it's hilarious and I'm glad they added this. There are classes to attend as part of the main quests and assignments to complete which reward spells. Side arcs and quests are just as good as the main content. The boss fights though are not as spectacular.The protagonist and the main cast's performance is easily one of the highlights of the game. The female voice for the protagonist is very pleasant with some funny lines of dialogue. Some cutscenes are pre-rendered but feature great action.Gear customization is perfect. There are an insane amount of options to choose from combined with the Transmog system. Character creation is well done. The game really needs a photo mode.The Room of Requirement and its related activities are an absolute delight. It is superbly executed with incredible attention to detail and remarkable animations. Brewing potions, growing plants, taking care of magical beasts, designing the architecture are fun activities but they also provide benefits to the character. There are countless structures and decor to conjure, you can make the room look just as you wish. There is so much to do here that the Room of Requirement could be an entire game. Hogwarts is huge, full of puzzles and activities. The gameplay loop here is very enaging and makes you want to explore more. The outside of Hogwarts is just as huge with an insane amount of things to do, with beautiful landscapes and scenery. There are some puzzles called trials which are overdone and there are repetitive treasure vaults which are copy-pasted content. The trials and vaults can became a chore to complete if you want to finish all of them. The battle arenas are a fun distraction. Lots and lots of collectables are scattered throughout the world.Mountable creatures are a joy to ride, the broom stick is versatile enough to take shortcuts and land where you want. They make traversal fun.Soundtrack is superb, it has the vibe from the movies and is a delight to hear. The ambient music in the common rooms is also a nice touch.The four different houses to choose add some amount of re-playablity with each house having unique quests. Although the main story is linear, there are some decisions with consequences.Performance on PC is terrible to say the least. Despite shaders being compiled on the first boot and every boot having a pre-check for compiled shaders, there is stuttering at every turn inside Hogwarts. If you are someone with a high tolerance for stutter or cannot perceive it, then it's all good. But for the rest of us, it is painful and definitely the only thing bringing the entire experience down. The hotfixes and patches have not really helped much, with the frametime graph being a mess and full of hitches. I hope this takes the highest priority.Hogwarts Legacy is an amazing achievement by Avalanche Software and a must-play adventure.

review: You're a wizard, Harry.

author: Shadow Fox
review: This game probably won't age well.On release the game is very graphically beautiful, but the more you play the more you realise how shallow everything is.The biggest problem with the game is simply how tedious and repetitive the game play is. The game makes you repeatedly do the same thing within a short time span and reuses content constantly. The most egregious is lock picking. To lock pick you need to spin 2 wheels around until you see movement on two other gears. The game makes you unlock EVERY SINGLE DAM DOOR that you don't have open at the start of the game. It does short cut where if you lock pick into a room you don't need to lock pick out again, but a lot of lock picked rooms then have a chest that requires lock picking or a second room that requires lock picking, and there is no variance in the lock picking game. It never gets harder or easier.The entire game is like that. Combat is incredibly trivial and tedious, with the same enemies and the same abilities. Sometimes however they also give the enemies excessive amounts of life, so you're just left clicking for 20mins while not taking damage because the AI has gotten stuck on something once again. Most spells are mechanically exactly the same as one another.It's all just a slog. Play if you're a Harry Potter fan or want to see the world, but don't expect much fun after the first 10hrs.

author: iChandler
review: Awesome! A RPG game with simple mechanics and a world full of life. I am not going to declare myself a Harry Potter  super-fan but I have enjoyed watching all of the Harry Potter and Fantastic Beast movies and must say the game is spot on to what you would expect in the Wizarding World. Its a pleasure to see the castle layout and feel exactly how Potter and his friends would of felt getting lost. Hogsmead is just as detailed and brought to life as the world of hidden secrets that you unfold are just detailed. The ONLY CRITICIZING I must say is, Why did they not make this co-op or bring a multiplayer aspect to this. I give props to the creators for bringing back a great RPG setup which feels like a game and not a headache. If you want good money spent on a game, I do recommend buying.

author: Bozichko
review: I will start with - this is the first and last game I have ever pre-ordered. I was so hyped about the game after all these years - a Harry Potter game with modern graphics. I will point out the bad sides first. 1. The game is dashingly predictable. The story is boring (SPOILERS!!!), I am the ultra young hero that defeated and killed wizards with muuuch more experience than me. Sure. Booooring. 2. I start from 5th year and I miss all the fun from the beginning, all the spell learning, classes, etc. 3. Every single NPC besides the ones for the quests, feel like the training dummies I test my magic on. They do not feel living, they kinda just stay there, like cardboard characters. 4. This should must've been a MMORPG game, where we start from 1st year, learn, duel each other, form teams, eventually story unwinds that Hogwarts will be attacked eventually, we participate in different events where we learn newer and newer stuff, the years go by, we get better and better, whole game goes darker, more enemies spawn, attack us, lure us, etc. Eventually we get to a point where we have to defend Hogwarts and if we fail - then we have to retake it. All of us should've had our own paths, become herbalists, beast masters, potion maters, etc, fight with what we chose, explore the world, gather, learn. Have different character personalities - like being bad or arrogant, or good, or selfish, etc. 6. Game becomes repetitive fast, especially with all the cut scenes that you cannot cancel (like Merlin trials) - it gets annoying. 7. The whole world feels... small. Yes, there's lots to explore, but it gets the same after some time. Spiders, inferni, some water enemies and loalists. That's it. Few trolls and few wolves. 8. The game is badly optimized for PC, it works, but it requires a lot of hardware to be ran on maximum graphics where you do not get much better graphics, to be honest. 9. Conversations are dull, you cannot make proper conversation, it's very straightforward and there are "choices" that do not affect anything of the end game. 10. All the teachers are bad copy from the teachers of the HP saga, visually and character like. 11. If it was a 10$ game - it would be okay. But 50-70$ game - it's definitely not worth the money,Overall - meh. It's playable, it's just not what it could've been - a masterpiece. Now it's just another game we will forget in several months.
