author: Redkitties
review: REVIEW SCORE: 3/10WHY:Combat:No invincible frames while casting. Want to use the tools/utilities the game encourages you to use? Interupted while using plant bombs, doesn't go off, no invinc frames. Want to use a potion that'll help with the 5+ mobs the game throws at you during main and side quests? You click it, drink it, and get interrupted, doesn't go off, damage taken because no invincible frames. Want to cast a spell to break an enemies shield? If you can SEE it- these things flicker in and out of existence- wondering why it's taking no damage? the INVISIBLE shield it has! guess you'll just have to squint and try the 3 different types of spells you have- but WAIT, as you cast a spell, it gets interrupted because there's NO INVINCIBLE FRAMES. Want to cast your own shield? it lasts half a second! because unlike the enemies, it WORKS DIFFERENT, for some unknown reason, it's more like a parry than a shield! But thank goodness you have a dodge that you can be hit out of rolling/aparating (with the talent upgrade), and even when you complete your dodge roll, the enemy has blinked to where you come out of it and hits you with such a short warning simple- THAT DOESN'T PROC/SHOW MORE THAN HALF THE TIME- that you can't even dodge again, or cast your shield spell. On top of that, the enemies have lazer focus on you, so you get double hit by a spell and the melee enemy! And that's not even mentioning the enemy AoE effects! Like the warning prompts to shield or dodge, these ground AoE effects are so faint! In every situation where you're thrown 5+ enemies in a gauntlet, you can use this AoE lightning potion that is SUPER helpful- it breaks enemy shields and deals damage! But wait! the enemy (ONE enemy, as far as i can tell) has a lighting AoE spell as well! and it DOESN'T show up at all when you're using this potion! So you just get one shot!Oh, and your spell range is very short. so for big enemies, you still feel like you're in their face and you can't effectively kite.EDIT: i forgot to add, when you play on PC/keyboard+mouse, it's frustrating to have like 20 spells, and only be able to cast 4 at a time/have access to 4 spells. You have to swap between 4 different groups of 4 spells. makes it incredibly difficult to have fluid combat. I wish there was an option where i could just have a spell bar, honestly. ( I ended up using a mod from nexus that let me rebind the other keys so that when i hit "5" it would swap spell group and cast number 1 of that spell group. It was nice, i just had to commit the spell slots to memory during my 70 hours of playing,MonkaS.)0/10 FRUSTRATING COMBAT.Note: I did play on the Hardest difficulty, and all it did was promote me stacking health potions. Get hit once? health pot because all my health is gone. Even with the best gear upgraded and slotted with this games form of "gems".STORY: Honestly, the side quests were WAY more interesting than the main quest. NO, it's not because of hate crime. Although playing through this game, at every turn I did have moments of joking with myself, going "Wow, Hogwarts promotes teaching children to steal, break into peoples houses, never go to class (as they were always short cinematic that did nothing and didn't add anything to the story) endorses slavery with house elf's still, enforces racial biases are cultural norm with how goblins and centaurs are seen by the character world," just all in good humor of pointing out these big no-nos.Talking about the spells, as someone who played all of the harry potter games as they came out, I already knew all of them! including some that weren't even in this game! So as I found myself doing the pre-quests to unlock the spells, i found myself, a seasoned harry potter gamer, frustrated and low on patience, because these pre-requests to unlock the quests were filler- they offered nothing to enrich the experience of playing the game, and barely added any lore to the known universe.The side quests, as I said, were fantastic. I liked the side characters, and I wish that there were more. Some classes let you talk with other characters, and I wish each of them, who had names and I recalled their faces/models, got the same character/friendship quest lines as three of the side characters did. As someone who played Mass Effect and Dragon Age, I am down to do 8 character side quests that adds and expands on not only the main story, but the characters themselves, as well as the universe around me, the player character. The main story was short, disappointing- but only because it was boring. Go here, do this, big battle royal and boss fight, all x 4. Then, another, and then, the last boss fight. Which, had the same combat problems as I listed above that i'll list/summarize here so it's easier to digest: AoE prompts too quick to respond to, no ground AoE warnings, no invincible frames when I cast, No STUN reward on the boss when I complete mechanics that diffidently seem like they should- at least in every other video game I have played.Honestly I have no idea how i would improve on the main quest besides adding real choices that aren't just "Keep things the way things are" or "Do the bad thing that x,y,z, but not really, because I'm still the main protag, so I have to be morally good." No ambiguous choice, no morally gray, not even a "RED" option that would be "DESTROY". Something that I was actually really surprised of, because in this case, I DO want to destroy the reapers- and I'm not given the option?! Crazy.Side quests: 5/10, Carried the game hard. Main quest: 1/10 was okay, eh, could have made the game without it and I would not have missed it. Honestly. It's okay to just make friends and stop "petty" crime as a 15-year-old, I don't have to save the world every damn time.EXPLORATION: Not as bad as what assassins creed as become. Yes when you complete something there's still that annoying unstoppable cut scene, like every time you would take down stealthily someone in Deus Ex except 5 times longer. Yes, there's flying. Yes, there's collecting. Yes, there's marking things off the map and feeling satisfied. Yes, there's clothing shopping and transmog. Yes, there's even breeding animals in your broom cupboard! But does the things add any lore or imagination or thought to the world? not really, no. So...It's just things to do and things to unlock. Minimal satisfaction, and luckily, there's enough that you can staggar the side quests and main quests with the exploration so you don't feel like you're dead, awake, and just doing chores.Overall? Maybe a 4/10. Water textures kept bugging and threatening to crash my game.I read ahead online and saw there was a checklist to graduate your school year after you complete the main quest- as i'm writing this critique on a break from the last boss. I think from exploring throughout my 51 hours of gameplay, I have that checklist done except for the remaining two(?) post-game quests. So that's nice, I guess.Overall, I wouldn't recommend this game, and If I did, I would tell everyone to buy it for around 30% off, and play on the easiest difficulty, because the hardest one is not satisfactory, especially with how the combat is. Still, I did enjoy seeing a new harry potter universe game, and I hope that this low scoring and the problems I have listed do not discourage but instead encourage a better next video game, whatever this company might make. And that we don't always need to be in High School to be a wizard/witch, the world/universe exists outside of Hogwarts/childhood.And if anyone is wondering HOW I COULD BUY this video game because of who receives the money?I'll humbly service my fellow Queer people until the good orgasms out way the whatever 40-some percent goes into the coffers of someone whose far richer than the Late Queen of England.

author: Cryptid Queen
review: As much as I'm enjoying the gameplay itself and the beautiful world, I can't recommend buying this game in it's current state. The intro gives false hopes as the game starts becoming a stutterfest with massive and constant FPS drops when you arrive at Hogwarts. From there the performance has not gotten better. I'm running 1440p High preset, no RT with 60 FPS cap. Did not see any performance difference after changing settings so I left it at the recommended High preset. Hopefully some patches will come through to properly optimize the performance but right now, don't make the purchase. I will say that the temps on my card are superb compared to other intensive AAA titles, though. If the game sees performance patches, I will gladly change my review to recommended.Gameplay = FantasticPerformance = CrapSPECS:RTX 3070 8GBi7-11700f32GB RAM 3200MhzGame is running off a 1TB 980 Pro M.2 SSD.EDIT: The day one patch did fix a slight amount of stuttering, however the majority of the performance issues are still prevalent. Hogsmeade is probably the worst right now, with 33-43 FPS being the average in that area. Traveling inside Hogwarts still gives massive drops. The combat is done extremely poorly here. No way to train or practice and the very little combat you have thrown at you doesn't not give you time to feel out the controls. I'm like 10 hours in and still haven't gotten my own broom, so anyone saying the story mode is only 20 hours is lying. I'll still be waiting on a real patch to fix the serious performance issues most seem to be having.EDIT EDIT: Most of the performance issues have been ironed out. Hogsmeade still has a bad stutter issue but other than that, the game runs incredibly smoother than before. I can now fully recommend purchasing the game in this state. I still think the combat could have been handled better earlier into the game. After the patches, I can now run the game at Ultra (except for effects because High looks wayyyy better than Ultra)

author: TheMotherOfZombiez
review: Enjoying it a lot, not in a big rush to finish it. I'm having fun exploring and goofing off while completing all quests.

author: KnightLevi
review: Overall Score: 6.8/10I will preface this by saying if you don't like Harry Potter, know nothing of it, and/or don't really care to get into it DON'T BUY THIS GAME. Spend your time elsewhere. If, on the other hand, you love Harry Potter and would like the chance to explore Hogwarts (Unfortunately everything else isn't really the same and even Hogwarts is somewhat different...) Then this is the game for you!Great game, HUGE open world that I was so excited to explore, great quests, puzzles, and mini games. I'm only 9 hours in and there is still so much I haven't had the chance to do that I'm so excited for. Even after getting through the main story I'm sure I'm going to have a lot to do. They paid extremely close attention to detail including things like little enchanted tools you can interact with or tulips(?) that make a funny noise when you walk by them (definitely the smallest feature I had the most fun with), or the candy store with all sorts of funny effects (unfortunately you can't take them out of the store.). I ABSOLUTELY LOVE the fact that there are "Guide Pages" in the game. They are little lore tidbits that you can find here and there while exploring and it not only incentivizes exploration, but makes it feel like you really have a reason to wander around and just look at the huge world that's been laid out before you.Complaint #1 - was that it feels almost like the LGBTQ content was forced down my throat just because it's "politically correct" to be put in the game. Personally I feel like it was only included due to the backlash J.K. Rowling received for some of her comments on twitter just to not only defend herself but also expand the audience to those she may have previously offended. I have nothing against the LGBTQ community my complaint is due to the fact that peoples beliefs and way of living become marketing strategies. That's just horrible to me. It doesn't detract from the game in any meaningful way it just kind of urked me a bit.  Correct me if you believe I'm wrong. Complaint #2 - The voices are messed up. Any character (including your own) whose voice has been edited with the pitch slider sounds like a robot and it really breaks immersion.Complaint #3 - Optimization is DOGSH!T. I have to run the game on the lowest settings to play... Not too terrible for myself as I do like to play a few older games such as TESIII:Morrowind and graphics don't bother me as much however, in today's day and age graphics are almost everything. Not to mention the game is nearly unplayable due to the glitches and bugs for most people who aren't as lucky as I am.

author: doubledms93
review: definitely doesn't deserve such high praise though it does recreate the Harry Potter theme quite well. i cant recommend unless you have a really good running PC. i run a 2060 super with a i7 10th gen and 16gs of ram and it stutters like crazy. I haven't run into anything such poorly optimized at launch and still no update addressing this.
